net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Class TableSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.AbstractTableModel
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.TableMap
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.TableSorter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, TableModelListener, TableModel

    public class TableSorter
extends TableMap

    A sorter for TableModels. The sorter has a model (conforming to TableModel) and itself implements TableModel. TableSorter does not store or copy the data in the TableModel, instead it maintains an array of integers which it keeps the same size as the number of rows in its model. When the model changes it notifies the sorter that something has changed eg. "rowsAdded" so that its internal array of integers can be reallocated. As requests are made of the sorter (like getValueAt(row, col) it redirects them to its model via the mapping array. That way the TableSorter appears to hold another copy of the table with the rows in a different order. The sorting algorthm used is stable which means that it does not move around rows when its comparison function returns 0 to denote that they are equivalent.

    NOTE: When using this class to wrap a TableModel, remember that all row indicies refer to the TableSorter, NOT the TableModel being wrapped. In order to get the the correct value when using a row index from the Table methods or from a table event, it is important to either hold a reference to the TableSorter or use the Table.getModel() method to get the model. The latter is preferred.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

        public java.lang.String getRowId(int rowIndex)
        Description copied from class: TableMap
        Forward to the underlying model. Returns null.

        Get an unqiue ID for the row. This ID will be used in some mediums to find the row in the case where the model and user interface become inconsistent. When accessing the table model, the ID may be used to find the row index.

        This method may return null if not supported.

      • tableChanged

        public void tableChanged(TableModelEvent e)
        Marks the model as needing to be sorted and forwards the event to the underlying model. By default forward all events to all the listeners. This fine grain notification tells listeners the exact range of cells, rows, or columns that changed.
